messages.title: Fighting for Services, Fighting for Louth & Horncastle
messages.content: For a Properly Funded NHS, For Investment in Education and Young People, For the Local Environment and Against Climate Change

messages.title: A MESSAGE FROM ELLIE GREEN
messages.content: Dear Residents, I am Ellie Green, and I would like to ask you to vote for me in the coming general election. I grew up in Chapel St Leonards, went to Skegness Grammar School and have lived in Louth, teaching as a primary supply teacher, and now based in Grimsby as a librarian. I have also been involved in local campaigns to save our libraries and local environmental projects. Our current MP and Tory government have neglected public services, especially for those most in need... If you agree with us on these issues please give me your vote on December 12th. Your Labour candidate, Ellie Green.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Ensuring the NHS receives the proper funding to provide quality health services.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: For Investment in Education and Young People
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Improve education standards, reduce class sizes, and provide young people with opportunities.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: For the Local Environment and Against Climate Change
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Make sustainable investments in renewable energy, fisheries, and future markets to protect the environment.

endorsements.endorsement: I truly believe that the Labour Party has by far the most intelligent, reasonable suggestions about how to unify our country's embattled people; proper grownup ideas for developing a fairer, more mutually beneficial society.
